rationale: No intensifier or comparative directly modifies a risk-adjective.
The segment reports costs factually ('estimated the cost... was more than $1 billion') without high-potency framing.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
This reports negative economic facts and costs but contains no explicit calming cue.
The segment does not contain a minimiser combined with a scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
The segment describes impact/cost, not capability or preparedness measures themselves.
Reports costs ('more than $1 billion', '$879 million', '$200 million') using standard verbs.
